Static Private Attributes

static int counter = 0
 static counter that counts the number of PHM objects running in the program
static int ** ph2s
 static list of dimension [n_ph][2] that takes in a ph index i and returns two sp indices: a = ph2s[i][0] and b = ph2s[i][1]
static int ** s2ph
 static list of dimension [M][M] that takes two sp indices a,b and returns a ph index i: i = s2t[a][b]

ostream & operator<< (ostream &output, const PHM &phm_p)

Detailed Description

Author:
Brecht Verstichel
Date:
23-02-2010

This class, PHM, is a class written for particle-hole matrices, it inherits all the functions from its mother class Matrix, some special member functions and two lists that give the relationship between the sp and the ph basis.

Definition at line 17 of file PHM.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

PHM::PHM ( int  M,
int  N 
)

standard constructor: constructs Matrix object of dimension M*M and if counter == 0, allocates and constructs the lists containing the relationship between sp and ph basis.

Parameters:
M nr of sp orbitals
N nr of particles

Definition at line 22 of file PHM.cpp.

PHM::PHM ( PHM &  phm_c  ) 

copy constructor: constructs Matrix object of dimension M*M and copies the content of phm_c into it, if counter == 0, allocates and constructs the lists containing the relationship between sp and ph basis.

Parameters:
phm_c PHM to be copied into (*this)

Definition at line 69 of file PHM.cpp.

PHM::~PHM (  )  [virtual]

destructor: if counter == 1 the memory for the static lists ph2s en s2ph twill be deleted.

void Matrix::diagonalize ( double *  eigenvalues  )  [inherited]

Diagonalizes symmetric matrices. Watch out! The current matrix (*this) is destroyed, in it the eigenvectors will be stored (one in every column).

Parameters:
eigenvalues the pointer of doubles in which the eigenvalues will be storen, Watch out, its memory has to be allocated on the dimension of the matrix before you call the function.

void Matrix::L_map ( Matrix &  map,
Matrix &  object 
) [inherited]

Multiply symmetric matrix object left en right with symmetric matrix map to form another symmetric matrix and put it in (*this): this = map*object*map

Parameters:
map matrix that will be multiplied to the left en to the right of matrix object
object central matrix

int  b,

Parameters:

Friends And Related Function Documentation

ostream& operator<< ( ostream &  output,
const PHM &  phm_p 
) [friend]

Output stream operator overloaded, the usage is simple, if you want to print to a file, make an ifstream object and type:

object << phm_p << endl;

For output onto the screen type:

cout << phm_p << endl;

Parameters:
output The stream to which you are writing (e.g. cout)
phm_p the TPM you want to print
